ğŸŒŸDubai BIM Submission: Revit Add-on for Native Model QA/QC ValidationğŸŒŸ The Dubai BIM submission platform includes QA/QC functionality to verify whether uploaded IFC files meet information requirements. Recently, this QA/QC functionality has been made available as a desktop app for end-users to generate the QA/QC report locally and speed up the validation process. In both scenarios, using the online platform or the desktop app, end-users are required to export their BIM models to IFC for QA/QC validation. The DM BIM submission platform is intentionally independent of any specific BIM authoring tool, and as such, currently lacks support or tools to validate native models against information requirements. Recognizing that many consultants in Dubai use Revit, I believe there is an opportunity for community-driven development of tools to validate native Revit BIM models against the DM BIM Submission requirements. As part of this effort, I have personally developed the alpha version of a Revit Add-on to process native Revit models and generate QA/QC reports without the need to export the model to IFC files. After running some testing, the source code for this Add-on will be made available on my GitHub account. It's important to note that the Revit Add-on is a personal initiative. The ultimate QA/QC validation of the BIM submission should always be conducted using the official Dubai BIM submission platform/apps. #BIM #Revit #BuildingInformationModeling #IFC #openBIM

Building Information Modelling (BIM) is a digital representation of the physical and functional characteristics of a building. Revit, developed by Autodesk, is a powerful BIM tool used in architecture, engineering, and construction. ğŸ—ï¸ Key features of Revit include parametric modeling, where changes to one element automatically update related components, and a central database that enables collaboration among project team members. ğŸ”„ Revit allows users to create detailed 3D models, incorporating architectural, structural, and MEP (mechanical, electrical, plumbing) systems. This facilitates a comprehensive understanding of the building throughout its lifecycle. ğŸ”„ Parametric families in Revit enable the creation of intelligent objects that adapt to design changes, promoting efficiency and consistency. ğŸ’¡ The platform supports the generation of accurate construction documentation, including plans, sections, and elevations. ğŸ“„ Revit's collaborative features enable multiple team members to work on the same project simultaneously, enhancing communication and reducing errors. ğŸ¤ Through the integration of BIM data, Revit aids in project coordination, clash detection, and the identification of potential issues early in the design phase. ğŸ” Furthermore, Revit facilitates the extraction of quantities and data for cost estimation, scheduling, and facility management. ğŸ’° In conclusion, Revit is a comprehensive BIM tool that revolutionizes the design and construction process by fostering collaboration, efficiency, and accuracy. ğŸŒ #buildinginformationmodeling #buildinginformationmodeling #bim #bimmodeling #bimservices #bimmanagement #bimengineer #bimmodeler #bimspecialist #bimexperts

Adding 5D (cost dimension) in Revit involves integrating cost-related information into your BIM model. Hereâ€™s a general approach to achieve this: 1. Model the Project in 3D: â€¢ Ensure that your Revit model is detailed and accurate, including all elements that will incur costs, such as walls, doors, windows, structural elements, MEP components, and finishes. 2. Attach Cost Data to Elements: â€¢ Parameters: Use Revitâ€™s parameter system to add cost-related parameters to your model elements. These parameters can include unit costs, total costs, and other relevant financial data. â€¢ Schedules: Create Revit schedules to calculate quantities and costs. You can use these schedules to display the total cost of elements or categories of elements. 3. Use Cost Estimation Software: â€¢ Navisworks: Export your Revit model to Navisworks, which supports 4D and 5D BIM. Navisworks allows you to link your model elements to external cost databases or Excel spreadsheets. â€¢ Cost Management Software: Integrate your Revit model with cost management software like Autodeskâ€™s Assemble, CostX, or Vico Office, which are designed to handle 5D BIM. 4. Link to External Cost Databases: â€¢ Dynamo: Use Dynamo scripts to automate the process of attaching cost data to Revit elements. This can be useful for importing data from Excel or other databases. â€¢ API/Plugins: Utilize Revit API or specific plugins that support cost estimation and linking of cost data to model elements. 5. Create Cost Schedules and Reports: â€¢ Generate detailed cost schedules within Revit, showing the breakdown of costs by element, category, or phase. These schedules can be exported to Excel for further analysis and reporting. #5DBIM #BIM #Revit #ACC #Autodesk
